info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER...WEST CENTRAL INDIANA...NORTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND AND SOUTHERN ARMSTRONG COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 615 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sarver, or 11 miles southeast of Butler, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Kittanning, Harrison Township, Ford City, Leechburg, Sarver, Freeport, West Kittanning, Saxonburg, West Leechburg, Curtisville, Rural Valley, and West Lebanon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
